intro: Olsynium philippii subsp. illapelinum, commonly known as the Illapelinum lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant belongs to the Iridaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, thriving in temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
